latest.title: Democrats Ride Anti-Trump Message in Final Days of California Campaign
latest.summary: Proponents say voters are motivated by stopping President Trump. Republicans have already begun pointing fingers over lackluster fund-raising and coordination.

archive.title: Democrats Condemn Trump Officials for Boat Strike Secrecy
archive.summary: Senator Mark Warner said the administration’s decision to hold a Republicans-only briefing on the campaign was “corrosive to our democracy.”

archive.title: Sanctions Lifted on a Putin-Backed Autocrat After Lobbying by Trump Allies
archive.summary: The move benefits the Serbian politician Milorad Dodik, who had received support from Rudolph W. Giuliani, Michael T. Flynn, Laura Loomer and high-priced lobbyists.

archive.title: Mike Johnson Dismisses Trump Third Term Talk — But Applauds the ‘Trolling’
archive.summary: The speaker said he did not see a path to amending the Constitution to allow the president to seek a third term, but that it was fun to pretend he could to inflame Democrats.

archive.title: Trump Asks Supreme Court to Let Him Fire the Top Copyright Official
archive.summary: An appeals court sided with the director of the U.S. Copyright Office, saying her role is to work with Congress.

archive.title: How Canada Is Dealing With Its Latest Tussle With President Trump
archive.summary: Prime Minister Mark Carney is focusing on what the country can control, including looking for economic partnerships abroad, especially in Asia.

archive.title: Timothy Mellon Is Donor Who Gave $130 Million to Pay Troops During Shutdown
archive.summary: Timothy Mellon is a billionaire and a major financial backer of President Trump.

archive.title: Trump to Use $130 Million Donation to Help Pay Troops
archive.summary: It is not clear how far the gift will go toward covering the salaries of the nation’s 1.3 million troops.

archive.title: A Pile of Rubble: After 123 Years, the East Wing Is Gone
archive.summary: Mourners are outraged over President Trump’s demolition of the East Wing to make way for his $300 million ballroom. Others say it was time for change.

archive.title: Trump Is Demolishing the White House’s East Wing to Make Way for His Ballroom
archive.summary: President Trump initially said the construction would not touch the East Wing or “interfere with the current building.”

archive.title: Jack Smith’s lawyers say he never wiretapped or surveilled lawmakers.
archive.summary: Lawyers for the special counsel, who investigated Donald J. Trump, denied accusations by Republican lawmakers that he had surveilled or spied on senators as part of his inquiry.

archive.title: Appeals Court Ruling Allows Trump to Deploy National Guard Troops to Portland
archive.summary: Deployment can move forward, for now, under a preliminary ruling by the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit. But legal wrangling will likely continue.

archive.title: U.S. Kills 3 on Boat Suspected of Smuggling Drugs for Colombian Rebels
archive.summary: It was the seventh known strike in President Trump’s military campaign of attacking, rather than arresting, those suspected of running drugs in the Caribbean.

archive.title: U.S. Is Repatriating Survivors of Its Strike on Suspected Drug Vessel
archive.summary: Two men rescued by the U.S. military after it attacked a boat in the Caribbean Sea were being sent to their home countries of Colombia and Ecuador, President Trump said.

archive.title: Benioff Apologizes for Saying Trump Should Send Troops to San Francisco
archive.summary: Marc Benioff, the chief executive of Salesforce, said he no longer believed that National Guard troops were needed in the city.

archive.title: Terrorism Charges Against Antifa ‘Cell’ Show Administration’s Focus on the Left
archive.summary: President Trump has spoken at times of antifa as though it were a clear-cut extremist organization, but the movement is a decentralized collection of loosely affiliated groups.

archive.title: Trump Signs Memo Expanding His Authority to Spend Federal Money
archive.summary: The president gave Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth wide authority to repurpose funds to pay members of the military without approval from Congress, which has the sole constitutional authority to decide federal spending.

archive.title: U.S. Military Kills 6 People in Boat Attack Near Venezuela, Trump Says
archive.summary: In a social media post, the president said the people aboard a boat were suspected of smuggling drugs for an unspecified group his team had labeled terrorists.

archive.title: Part Enabler, Part Buffer: The Bind of the Justice Dept.’s No. 2
archive.summary: Todd Blanche, the deputy attorney general, has helped usher in President Trump’s retribution campaign. But he faces anger on the right for resisting some of the most extreme measures.

archive.title: Why Now? The Lost Chances to Reach a Hostage Deal, and a Cease-Fire, Months Ago
archive.summary: On Gaza, President Trump put few, if any, guardrails on Israel’s offensive, bucking international demands for a cease-fire. Then he changed course.

archive.title: Among Portland Protests, It’s Frogs and Sharks and Bears, Oh My.
archive.summary: Images of anarchists clad in black gave the city a bad name in 2020. Now, demonstrators in Portland are poking fun at President Trump’s apocalyptic talk with colorful animal suits.

archive.title: Judge Orders ICE to Remove Fence Around Facility Near Chicago
archive.summary: The judge’s decision is the third in three days in Illinois against the Trump administration. It came after ICE said its Operation Midway Blitz would continue indefinitely.

archive.title: Appellate Judges Appear Open to Allowing National Guard Troops to Deploy to Portland
archive.summary: Three judges from the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit are reviewing an order blocking President Trump from deploying National Guard soldiers in the city.

archive.title: A Chicago federal grand jury deals the latest setback to Trump’s immigration enforcement efforts.
Mass Layoffs Trump Is Threatening in Shutdown Fight May Be Illegal
archive.summary: Unions have sued to block any firings, which budget experts believe are not even needed to protect essential federal services.

archive.title: Trump Gave Partisan Speech to Navy Troops, as He Deployed Troops to U.S. Cities
archive.summary: President Trump’s attempts to politicize the military have become more overt as he makes the case for having troops at his disposal in American cities.

archive.title: Trump Renews Layoff Threats as Shutdown Accusations Continue to Fly
archive.summary: Senator Chuck Schumer and Speaker Mike Johnson each accused the other of not being “serious” about talks to end the shutdown as the government was closed for a fifth day.

archive.title: Who Still Has Temporary Protected Status Under Trump?
archive.summary: Conflicting court rulings have plunged hundreds of thousands of people with temporary protection from deportation into uncertainty.

archive.title: Marc Rowan, a Billionaire Financier, Is Behind Trump’s Deal for Universities
archive.summary: The conservative ideas behind the Trump administration’s “compact” for universities were developed in part by Marc Rowan, a wealthy financier who has sought to shape higher education.

archive.title: Trump ‘Determined’ the U.S. Is Now in a War With Drug Cartels, Congress Is Told
archive.summary: A notice calls the people the U.S. military recently killed on suspicion of drug smuggling in the Caribbean Sea “unlawful combatants.”

archive.title: Environmental Protection Agency Employees Working Despite Furloughs Plan
archive.summary: E.P.A. employees said that they were working without pay, and that Trump administration officials had not told them how long the funding would last. Union officials said they were “highly confused.”
